metadata.title: CVE-2020-36427 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
GNOME gThumb before 3.10.1 allows an application crash via a malformed JPEGimage.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36427` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gthumb - 3:3.6.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
gthumb-data - 3:3.6.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gthumb package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3:3.6.1-1ubuntu0.1~esm1').
